content.p: Assistant Professor, Jaya Kumar graduated from University Putra Malaysia with a BSc in Biotechnology and from University Kebangsaan Malaysia with an MSc in Genetics. He also has a Cambridge International Diploma for Teachers and Trainers. Eventually, he pursued and completed a Postgraduate Certificate for Higher Education from the University of Nottingham Malaysia. Jaya has a PhD in Psychology from the University of Nottingham Malaysia (UNM), through which he studied the effects of stereotype threat on students within a classroom setting. Jaya taught A Level, UNSW Foundation Year and AUSMAT Biology for 7 years prior to joining UNM in 2013 to teach Biology in the Foundation in Science. He currently Heads the Foundation in Science in UNM. Jaya Kumar is a Senior Fellow of the UK Higher Education Academy (now know as Advance HE) and the Director of the Nottingham Recognition Scheme in UNM. These roles has provided the opportunity for Jaya to also be the pioneering Deputy Chair of the Malaysian Senior Fellows Working Group. He is also a Professional Technologist with the Malaysian Board of Technologists (MBOT). His interest in teaching and learning has also led to his involvement in the Teaching and Learning Observation College as an Associate and he is a two-time Lord Dearing Award recipient.
